cwn_entry.cwn_what:
Here are some links to messages at <http://discuss.ocaml.org> that may be of interest to the readers.
- Rudi Grinberg talks about "Curly - Curl CLI Wrapper" <https://discuss.ocaml.org/t/ann-curly-curl-cli-wrapper/693/1> - Thomas Leonard talks about "capnp-rpc 0.1" <https://discuss.ocaml.org/t/ann-capnp-rpc-0-1/698/1> - Alessandro Strada talks about "google-drive-ocamlfuse 0.6.21" <https://discuss.ocaml.org/t/ann-google-drive-ocamlfuse-0-6-21/711/1> - Christophe talks about "Root1D version 0.5" <https://discuss.ocaml.org/t/ann-root1d-version-0-5/715/1>

cwn_entry.cwn_who: Gabriel Scherer and the editor compiled this list
cwn_entry.cwn_what:
Here is a sneak peek at some potential future features of the Ocaml compiler, discussed by their implementers in these Github Pull Requests.
- Disable cplugins feature by default https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/1242 - Avoid formatter flushes inside exported printers in Location https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/1281 - Accept aliases in exception patterns https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/1283

Here are links from many OCaml blogs aggregated at OCaml Planet, <http://ocaml.org/community/planet/>.
Transpose <http://blog.shaynefletcher.org/2017/08/transpose.html>
Full Time: Software Developer (Functional Programming) at Jane Street in New York, NY; London, UK; Hong Kong <http://jobs.github.com/positions/0a9333c4-71da-11e0-9ac7-692793c00b45>
